Being built in Siteleaf with Josiah Wiebe at Collectif.

item.title: Open House Interface
item.author: Jonathan Dueck
item.description:
At the end of our final year at Red River College, we held an Open House for the public, and for industry members. I was a part of the interface design team along with Sean Savoie and Nicole Vandemosselaer. We were tasked with creating an interactive class portfolio that would be displayed on a number of iMacs. I created the final mock-ups of the site—shown below—as well as coded part of the site.

Built in HTML and SASS. Mock-ups in Adobe Illustrator.

The home page features all students from all majors.

Major-filtered page. This example shows the web majors.

Student page.

Portfolio lightbox on student page, showcasing larger views of their work.

item.title: Status Update
item.author: Jonathan Dueck
item.description:
Today I begin work as the web designer at Co-op@Home. It’s sort of a “Part II” to Josiah’s “Thus Begin a New Era” as I am filling the role that he left.

Red River classes are over for me, so I’m done college classes for the foreseeable future. College has felt like both a long time and a short time, and it’s strange to be done. I made friends with a score of great young designers, and I’ll miss them along with their city, but I’ll try to visit. When I started college, I began every day by listening to The Weakerthans’ One Great City for the first couple of weeks. However, I don’t know if I hate Winnipeg anymore. I think I’ve grown rather fond of it.

But it’s good to be back. Good to be amongst friends. Good to be starting an exciting new job.

-JD

P.S. Shoutout to DMD 2014 as you begin your work placements

item.title: Those Were The Days
item.author: Jonathan Dueck
item.description:
Every year in spring, the Back 40 Folk Festival puts on a sixties-themed show, with a number of local bands covering period artists, as a fundraiser for the festival. I was asked to shoot some photos for their website.

Lakes and Pines as Pearl Jam

Hey Zeus Marimba as The Band


With guest Link Neufeld of Link and the Moustaches

Janessa Freeheart as Sineed O'Connor

Intermission with Karl Redding of Lakes and Pines

Paige Drobot and The Psychics as George Carlin and Parliament

item.title: Rhyme & Rhythm

item.description:
Website for wedding cinematographer Rhyme & Rhythm Cinematography. Built in Siteleaf with Josiah Wiebe at Collectif.

View at rhymeandrhythm.ca

item.title: Garden Valley Collegiate
item.author: Jonathan Dueck
item.description: At Collectif, we had the honor of redesigning our old high school’s identity. The school was an important place for me, as it was one of my teachers that encouraged me to pursue design, and to attend Red River College. We wanted to develop an identity that students could be proud of.

item.title: Bitmap Fest
item.author: Jonathan Dueck
item.description:
Bitmap Fest is a fictional film festival “held” at Red River College. The assignment was to create a series of film posters for movies from 1983—Flashdance, WarGames and Scarface. We were provided with two to three black & white images per poster and could use one. All type except for the A headings had to be set in the same face, size and weight.

I decided to make a series of posters based on creating a pattern with the image. From a distance, the posters all look fairly similar, but up close the posters are made up of unique images.

item.title: Gig Poster
item.author: Jonathan Dueck
item.description: One of our Graphic Design projects was to create a gig poster. I chose the band Arcade Fire and designed a poster with three variations based on an abstraction of an aerial view of a Haitian village, as the country is dear to the band and an inspiration for their latest record.

item.title: Jason & Alli
item.author: Jonathan Dueck
item.description: For their wedding, Jason and Alli Zacharias had me make record labels for records that would serve as guest books. There were two labels made—one with their names on it and one with their wedding date.
